WithoutWyll.synopsis: Confrontation with Eltan noble if Ravengard died and Florrick is dead or still in prison. Wyll is not with party in this version
WithoutWyll.how_to_trigger: - Kill Ravengard and Counsellor Florrick;- Send Wyll to camp- Go to 33; 35; -41;OR- Use origin debug book to go to Wyll's Act3 moments;- Florrick Confrontation;

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM.synopsis: Confrontation with Eltan noble if Ravengard died and Florrick is dead or still in prison.
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM.how_to_trigger: - Kill Ravengard and Counsellor Florrick;- Go to 33; 35; -41;OR- Use origin debug book to go to Wyll's Act3 moments;- Florrick Confrontation;

OM_Wyll.synopsis: Confrontation with Eltan noble if Ravengard died and Florrick is dead or still in prison.
OM_Wyll.how_to_trigger: - Kill Ravengard and Counsellor Florrick;- Go to 33; 35; -41;OR- Use origin debug book to go to Wyll's Act3 moments;- Florrick Confrontation;

WithoutWyll_8.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_8.text: You. The gods-damned disease of the Gate.
WithoutWyll_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

WithoutWyll_79.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_79.text: Lady Mizora told me everything. How you and the Blade of Frontiers slaughtered his own father, how he craves ultimate power.

WithoutWyll_33.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_33.text: How he means to make the city bow to him and him alone.

WithoutWyll_19.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_19.text: First I finish you. Then I finish the duke's traitorous son.

WithoutWyll_29.speaker: Player
WithoutWyll_29.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.

WithoutWyll_67.speaker: Player
WithoutWyll_67.text: The Blade has saved countless lives. He is still the man you thought he was.

WithoutWyll_42.speaker: Player
WithoutWyll_42.text: Ravengard could still be alive. And we intend to save him.

WithoutWyll_11.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

WithoutWyll_51.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_51.text: I believe you, the Battle Lord help me.

WithoutWyll_21.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_21.text: What darkness has fallen upon us.

WithoutWyll_68.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_68.text: Listen, there's something Wyll should know. On his way from Elturel, Ravengard sent a messenger with word of the cult.

WithoutWyll_70.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_70.text: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but he realised the danger before anyone else did.

WithoutWyll_31.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_31.text: He understood that if the cult were successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.

WithoutWyll_40.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_40.text: And he knew that to protect the city, one trained in the ways of the great champions would have to rouse the wyrm living beneath. If I'm not mistaken, that would be Wyll.

WithoutWyll_78.speaker: Player
WithoutWyll_78.text: Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?

WithoutWyll_7.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_7.text: A bronze dragon, to be precise, sleeping beneath us.

WithoutWyll_27.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_27.text: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.

WithoutWyll_54.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_54.text: He made Balduran a binding promise to protect the city when its need was greatest.

WithoutWyll_46.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_46.text: The city's survived countless threats. But Ravengard knew its walls would fall to the cult.

WithoutWyll_28.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_28.text: With him gone and the city near ruin, your call is to unleash the Heart of the Gate.

WithoutWyll_58.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_58.text: Take this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.

WithoutWyll_23.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_23.text: Follow its path to the wyrm. Or do not, and let the Coast be drowned in blood.

WithoutWyll_61.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_61.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek more allies to help our cause.

WithoutWyll_60.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_60.text: Dead? Blast - not what I wanted to hear.

WithoutWyll_34.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_34.text: The fate of the city now rests with us.

WithoutWyll_62.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_62.text: May Helm help us drive the Absolute from the Coast.

WithoutWyll_39.speaker: Player
WithoutWyll_39.text: Your faith in us is well-founded. We will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

WithoutWyll_30.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_30.text: I was right to lay down my arms, Foehammer be praised.

WithoutWyll_77.speaker: Player
WithoutWyll_77.text: Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.

WithoutWyll_24.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_24.text: Not a fairy tale, but a history, told far and wide by Balduran himself.

WithoutWyll_55.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_55.text: I should go, gather allies. We'll join you in your hour of need.

WithoutWyll_17.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_17.text: Free the wyrm, and may his thunderous wind drive the Absolute from the Coast.

WithoutWyll_75.speaker: Player
WithoutWyll_75.text: Let the dragon sleep. We'll deal with the Absolute on our own terms.

WithoutWyll_0.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_0.text: Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew one blade alone cannot rout an army.

WithoutWyll_69.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_69.text: Ravengard was that warrior. If his legacy is to live, you must release the wyrm.

WithoutWyll_65.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_65.text: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.

WithoutWyll_50.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_50.text: Find it, and follow its path to the wyrm. Or do not, and let the Coast be drowned in blood.

WithoutWyll_13.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_13.text: It is said that only a true champion can awaken the Wyrm. Now that the Grand Duke has fallen, the duty falls to his son.

WithoutWyll_53.speaker: Player
WithoutWyll_53.text: The city has found its protector, thank you very much. Me.

WithoutWyll_45.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_45.text: Only a true champion can awaken the wyrm. As the Blade of Frontiers, Wyll has proven his worth. Please, give him this message.

WithoutWyll_47.speaker: Player
WithoutWyll_47.text: Ravengard's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing we could do.

WithoutWyll_4.speaker: Player
WithoutWyll_4.text: Mizora lied to you. We tried to save Ravengard, and she sabotaged us.

WithoutWyll_20.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_20.text: Pitiful, how easy the lies come to you.

WithoutWyll_76.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_76.text: You killed the best of Baldur's Gate. May the Hells make you suffer.

WithoutWyll_41.speaker: Player
WithoutWyll_41.text: A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.

WithoutWyll_44.speaker: Narrator
WithoutWyll_44.text: *You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*

WithoutWyll_15.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_15.text: The Blade of Frontiers, nothing but a cold-blooded killer. I will make him and his allies pay for his father's death.

WithoutWyll_49.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_49.text: I will not play your mind games. To arms!

WithoutWyll_5.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_5.text: I am Cordula Eltan, heir to the hero who forged the Fist.

WithoutWyll_59.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_59.text: And you are the Hells' lowest dregs. I will not let Wyll take the city!

WithoutWyll_1.speaker: Player
WithoutWyll_1.text: Cordula Eltan. Your family has a storied history in this city.

WithoutWyll_6.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_6.text: My great grandfather built the Fist and forged its first blades.

WithoutWyll_43.speaker: Cordula Eltan
WithoutWyll_43.text: A man of honour - much like Wyll's father. How cold is your heart, that you'd be his butcher?

WithoutWyll_22.speaker: Player
WithoutWyll_22.text: Attack us, then. Let's see who's left standing.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_0.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_0.text: Wyll Ravengard - the stain of Baldur's Gate.
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_129.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_129.text: To think your father's blood flows through those damnable veins.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_45.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_45.text: Cordula Eltan? By the Nine Hells, what are you on about?
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_45.context: NodeContext: In both recognition and shock.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_48.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_48.text: Lady Mizora told me everything. How you slaughtered your own father, how you crave his power.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_99.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_99.text: How you mean to make the city bow to you and you alone.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_52.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_52.text: On my honour, father's still alive. And I intend to save him.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_29.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_29.text: Father's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing I could do!

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_26.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_26.text: She lied to you, Eltan. I did everything in my power to get my father to safety!

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_16.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_16.text: Pitiful, how easy the lies come to you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_109.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_109.text: Eltan. Mizora is a devil; I am my father's son. Will you really trust her word over mine?

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_23.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_23.text: Eltan. I am my father's son. Will you really trust the word of a devil over mine?

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_53.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_53.text: I swear I did everything I could to save him. I swear it by all I hold dear.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_14.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_14.text: Do you mean Ansur? He's naught but bones, Eltan. But his spirit has blessed me with power.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_110.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_110.text: Do you mean Ansur? The dragon is dead.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_6.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_6.text: A wyrm? Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_25.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_25.text: It will be done. I will seek the wyrm. Together, we will strike down the Absolute.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_55.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_55.text: Ravengard's blood courses through your veins. Your father would be proud.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_73.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_73.text: You killed the best of Baldur's Gate. May the Hells make you suffer.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_30.speaker: Narrator
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_30.text: *This woman is no stranger to you - Cordula Eltan, Baldur's Gate patriar and heir to the founder of the Flaming Fist.*

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_88.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_88.text: I won't have the Hells' errand boy poison Baldur's Gate!

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_116.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_116.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_50.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_50.text: I have saved countless lives. I am still the man you thought I was.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_65.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_42.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_42.text: On my honour, father's still alive. And I intend to save him.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_100.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_100.text: Father's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing I could do.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_36.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_36.text: Mizora is a devil - she lied to you. I wanted to save my father, and she sabotaged me.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_1.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_1.text: I believe you, the Battle Lord help me.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_58.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_58.text: What darkness has fallen upon us.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_39.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_39.text: Wyll, there's something you should know. On his way from Elturel, Ravengard sent a messenger with word of the cult.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_13.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_13.text: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but as usual he realised the danger before anyone else did.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_123.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_123.text: He understood that if the cult would be successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_33.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_33.text: And he knew that to protect the city, one trained in the ways of the champion would have to rouse the wyrm living beneath. If I'm not mistaken, that would be you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_63.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_63.text: Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_24.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_24.text: A bronze dragon, to be precise. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_7.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_7.text: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_22.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_22.text: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_44.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_44.text: Since then, the city faced countless threats, but the Baldurians overcame them all. There was never any need to call upon the wyrm. Until now.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_60.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_60.text: This is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. Your father was right - we need Ansur's help. With him gone, the wyrm's awakening now falls to you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_72.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_72.text: Take this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_8.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_8.text: Let it set the path before you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_43.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_43.text: Do you mean Ansur? The dragon is dead, Eltan.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_86.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_86.text: Dead? So once more, fortune turns against us.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_31.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_31.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_38.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_38.text: Do you mean Ansur? He's dead.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_4.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_4.text: I should go, gather allies. We'll join you in your hour of need.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_124.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_124.text: The fate of the city now rests with us.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_93.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_93.text: May your father's courage be with you. And may we drive the Absolute forever from the Coast.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_111.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_111.text: Your faith in me is well-founded. I will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_74.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_74.text: Thank you. In darkness, I see your light.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_87.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_87.text: Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_101.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_101.text: A history told by Balduran himself, stretching a thousand years back. It is no fable - it is plain truth.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_68.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_68.text: Let the dragon sleep. I'll deal with the Absolute on my own terms.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_122.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_122.text: Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew when to contain the storm and when to release it.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_17.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_17.text: That warrior was your father, Wyll. If you're to bear his legacy, you must release the wyrm.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_79.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_79.text: Free the wyrm, let his tempest swallow the Absolute and its allies. May Lady Tymora smile upon you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_120.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_120.text: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_125.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_125.text: Find it, and let it set its path before you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_105.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_105.text: A wyrm? Why is this the first I'm hearing about this?

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_67.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_67.text: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. Each of them will soon be put to the test.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_49.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_49.text: The city has found its protector, thank you very much. Me.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_46.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_46.text: Pitiful, how easy the lies come to you.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_5.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_5.text: You killed the best of Baldur's Gate. May the Hells make you suffer.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_20.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_20.text: A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_121.speaker: Narrator
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_121.text: *You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_119.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_119.text: Some hero. The Blade of Frontiers, nothing but a cold-blooded killer. I will make him pay for his father's death.

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_56.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_56.text: I will not play your mind games. To arms!

OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_66.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_AOM_OOM_66.text: Well played, Eltan. But you will not stand in my way - the city is mine by rights.

OM_Wyll_2.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_2.text: Wyll Ravengard - the stain of Baldur's Gate.
OM_Wyll_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

OM_Wyll_91.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_91.text: To think your father's blood flows through those damnable veins.

OM_Wyll_36.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_36.text: Cordula Eltan? By the Nine Hells, what are you on about?
OM_Wyll_36.context: NodeContext: In both recognition and shock.

OM_Wyll_39.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_39.text: Lady Mizora told me everything. How you slaughtered your own father, how you crave his power.

OM_Wyll_75.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_75.text: How you mean to make the city bow to you and you alone.

OM_Wyll_17.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_17.text: Shut it. My family's duty is to Baldur's Gate. I won't have the Hells' errand boy poison my city!
OM_Wyll_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan and her allies ready for battle.

OM_Wyll_53.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_53.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.

OM_Wyll_33.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_33.text: The Blade has saved countless lives. He is still the man you thought he was.

OM_Wyll_23.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_23.text: Eltan. I am my father's son. Will you really trust the word of a devil over mine?

OM_Wyll_44.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_44.text: I swear I did everything I could to save him. I swear it by all I hold dear.

OM_Wyll_54.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

OM_Wyll_3.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_3.text: I believe you, the Battle Lord help me.

OM_Wyll_47.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_47.text: What darkness has fallen upon us.

OM_Wyll_29.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_29.text: Wyll, there's something you should know. On his way from Elturel, Ravengard sent a messenger with word of the cult.

OM_Wyll_10.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_10.text: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but as usual he realised the danger before anyone else did.

OM_Wyll_87.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_87.text: He understood that if the cult would be successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.

OM_Wyll_26.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_26.text: And he knew that to protect the city, one trained in the ways of the champion would have to rouse the wyrm living beneath. If I'm not mistaken, that would be you.

OM_Wyll_28.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_28.text: A wyrm? Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?

OM_Wyll_24.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_24.text: A bronze dragon, to be precise. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.

OM_Wyll_7.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_7.text: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.

OM_Wyll_21.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_21.text: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.

OM_Wyll_35.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_35.text: Since then, the city faced countless threats, but the Baldurians overcame them all. There was never any need to call upon the wyrm. Until now.

OM_Wyll_48.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_48.text: This is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. Your father was right - we need Ansur's help. With him gone, the wyrm's awakening now falls to you.

OM_Wyll_55.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_55.text: Take this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.

OM_Wyll_8.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_8.text: Let it set the path before you.

OM_Wyll_72.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_72.text: Do you mean Ansur? The dragon is dead, Eltan.

OM_Wyll_25.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_25.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.

OM_Wyll_89.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_89.text: The fate of the city now rests with us.

OM_Wyll_73.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_73.text: May your father's courage be with you. And may we drive the Absolute forever from the Coast.

OM_Wyll_38.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_38.text: Do you mean Ansur? He's dead.

OM_Wyll_70.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_70.text: Dead? So once more, fortune turns against us.

OM_Wyll_16.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_16.text: Your faith in Wyll is well-founded. We will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

OM_Wyll_58.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_58.text: Thank you. In darkness, I see your light.

OM_Wyll_77.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_77.text: You're going to trust him? The man who made a pact with a devil?

OM_Wyll_11.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_11.text: Ravengard's blood runs through Wyll's veins. I choose to trust. I hope you choose to honour it.

OM_Wyll_5.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_5.text: I should go, gather allies. We'll join you in your hour of need.

OM_Wyll_64.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_64.text: Free the wyrm, let his tempest swallow the Absolute and its allies. May Lady Tymora smile upon you.

OM_Wyll_27.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_27.text: Wyll? What do you make of this?

OM_Wyll_6.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_6.text: Baldur's Gate stands on the brink of the abyss. We'll need all the help we can get. Let's awaken the wyrm, and take back the city.

OM_Wyll_45.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_45.text: Ravengard's blood courses through your veins. Your father would be proud.

OM_Wyll_62.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_62.text: Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.

OM_Wyll_78.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_78.text: A history told by Balduran himself, stretching a thousand years back. It is no fable - it is plain truth.

OM_Wyll_82.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_82.text: Let the dragon sleep. We'll deal with the Absolute on our own terms.

OM_Wyll_86.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_86.text: Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew when to contain the storm and when to release it.

OM_Wyll_15.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_15.text: That warrior was your father, Wyll. If you're to bear his legacy, you must release the wyrm.

OM_Wyll_85.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_85.text: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.

OM_Wyll_90.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_90.text: Find it, and let it set its path before you.

OM_Wyll_79.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_79.text: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. I remember the lessons well. Father made me recite them every morning.

OM_Wyll_22.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_22.text: It is said that only a true champion of Baldur's Gate can awaken the wyrm.

OM_Wyll_69.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_69.text: Waking a dragon doesn't sound like a good idea.

OM_Wyll_43.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_43.text: I believe Ravengard's still alive. And I intend to save him.

OM_Wyll_20.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_20.text: Ravengard's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing we could do.

OM_Wyll_60.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_60.text: Mizora lied to you. We wanted to save Ravengard, and she sabotaged us.

OM_Wyll_63.speaker: Wyll
OM_Wyll_63.text: It's true, Eltan. You can't believe her. She's a devil. Will you really trust her word over mine?

OM_Wyll_14.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_14.text: Pitiful, how easy the lies come to you.

OM_Wyll_56.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_56.text: You killed the best of Baldur's Gate. May the Hells make you suffer.

OM_Wyll_92.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_92.text: A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.

OM_Wyll_4.speaker: Narrator
OM_Wyll_4.text: *You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*

OM_Wyll_19.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_19.text: The Blade of Frontiers, hero of the Sword Coast - and his own father's killer. I can barely believe it.

OM_Wyll_46.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_46.text: I will not play your mind games. To arms!

OM_Wyll_59.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_59.text: I am Cordula Eltan, heir to the hero who forged the Fist.

OM_Wyll_57.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_57.text: And you are the Hells' lowest dregs. I will not let you take the city!

OM_Wyll_41.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_41.text: Cordula Eltan. Your family has a storied history in this city.

OM_Wyll_71.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_71.text: My great grandfather built the Fist and forged its first blades.

OM_Wyll_30.speaker: Cordula Eltan
OM_Wyll_30.text: A man of honour - much like your father, Wyll. How cold is your heart, that you'd be his butcher?

OM_Wyll_76.speaker: Player
OM_Wyll_76.text: Attack us, then. Let's see who's left standing.
